item.title: By: Ricardo
item.dc:creator: Ricardo
item.description:
Nice piece, Nanette.
Norman Rockwell seemed to be paintaing from another perspective, eventually.
Rockwell's varied image of Blacks https://www.csmonitor.com/1989/0605/unorm.html
https://www.nrm.org/2010/10/norman-rockwells-the-problem-we-all-live-with-continues-to-resonate-as-important-symbol-for-civil-rights/
item.content:encoded:
Nice piece, Nanette.

Norman Rockwell seemed to be paintaing from another perspective, eventually.

Rockwell’s varied image of Blacks

item.title: By: Nanette D. Massey
item.dc:creator: Nanette D. Massey
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://samj921.github.io/nanettedmassey/nuance-and-news/#comment-2">Gregory Fitzpatrick</a>.
Yep, Norman Rockwell.

item.title: By: Gregory Fitzpatrick
item.dc:creator: Gregory Fitzpatrick
item.description: Love your cover photo for your blog. That's a Norman Rockwell painting? That picture of perplex, is still with us today unfortunately. I think the painting goes back to the 1950's. In 2018, we still have this type of race animosity and it's embolden and growing with Trump.
item.content:encoded: Love your cover photo for your blog. That’s a Norman Rockwell painting? That picture of perplex, is still with us today unfortunately. I think the painting goes back to the 1950’s. In 2018, we still have this type of race animosity and it’s embolden and growing with Trump.
